org.jpws.front

Class PasswordDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.jpws.front.util.ButtonBarDialog
                • org.jpws.front.PasswordDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, ActivitySource

    public class PasswordDialog
extends ButtonBarDialog
implements ActivitySource
    Displays a modal password dialog box and handles user interaction with it. The purpose of this class is to render an input passphrase. It assumes one of 3 possible display and functional modi: ACCESS - for user password to access a database or object, DEFINE - for user definition of a new passphrase, and CONTROL - for any security password checking.
    Since:
    0-5-0 subclass of ButtonBarDialog
    Author:
    Wolfgang Keller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PasswordDialog

        public PasswordDialog(java.awt.Frame owner,
                      java.lang.String filename,
                      int modus)
               throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Creates a new PasswordDialog without an exit button.
        Parameters:
        owner - the parent Frame
        filename - text displayed emphasised for the input field; may be null
        modus - operation modus resulting in different text and title display ACCESS = input for file access (open) DEFINE = definition of new passphrase CONTROL = security request to enter existing passphrase
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException

      • PasswordDialog

        public PasswordDialog(java.awt.Frame owner,
                      java.lang.String filename,
                      int modus,
                      boolean exitActive)
               throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Creates a new PasswordDialog (full settings).
        Parameters:
        owner - the parent Frame
        filename - text displayed emphasised for the input field; may be null
        modus - operation modus resulting in different text and title display ACCESS = input for file access (open) DEFINE = definition of new passphrase CONTROL = security request to enter existing passphrase
        exitActive - if true the dialog shows a program exit button
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException

        the password entered in the dialog

        public ButtonBarDialog getPasswordInfoBox()

        Returns:

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        This should destroy the entered user value. Currently the underlying Java structure does not support secure erasing of all such content.

      • performed

        public static PasswordDialog performed(PwsFileContainer ct,
                                       java.lang.String filename,
                                       int modus,
                                       boolean exitActive)
                                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Performs a modal password dialog on the EDT and waits for its termination. The resulting dialog instance may be used to retrieve values.
        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer file container referenced, may be null
        filename - String naming part of the display message, may be null
        modus - int operation modus (DEFINE, ACCESS, CONTROL)
        exitActive - boolean true == a program exit button is shown
        Returns:
        PasswordDialog dialog instance after termination
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread was interrupted
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if dialog throws execution exception
